summary: REQ-20 slug validation logic was added via a new utility and is invoked in the Version 9 publish handler to block publishing when invalid. However, the diff snippet does not conclusively show that the error is rendered as a user-facing message in the UI (the render section is truncated). A few extra changes appear unrelated to the specific request (simulated publish/alert flow and meta/state summary files).

missing_requirements.requirement: If the requested production slug is missing or invalid, block publishing and show a clear, user-facing error message in English explaining the rule and requesting a corrected slug.
missing_requirements.reason: While validation is performed and publishing is blocked (early return), the provided EditPanel diff is truncated before the JSX that would display `slugError`. The diff summary does not definitively show the error message being rendered to the user.

hallucinated_features.description: Simulated publish behavior (console.log + setTimeout + alert) instead of/alongside real publish flow.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-20 only requires validation and blocking/allowing publish based on slug validity; it does not request adding a simulated publish action or alert dialogs.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated meta documentation/state files (frontend-file-summaries.txt, project_state.json) unrelated to slug validation.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks for production slug validation behavior when publishing Version 9; these meta/state summary updates are not requested requirements.
